info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 8:46PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms with torrential rain will impact portions of northwestern Caswell, southeastern Pittsylvania and western Halifax Counties and the City of Danville through 915 PM EDT... At 845 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms from Keeling to Blanch. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, torrential rain and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Ponding of water and low lying street flooding especially in and around Danville. Locations impacted include... Danville... Chatham... Blairs... Ingram... Mt Airy... Milton... and Java. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
